comments:
I use CVSNT 1.11.1.3 (build 57b) as server with the pserver protocol, user is 
my domain user (with a password), repository is "/var/cvs" (which is 
translated to "C:\var\cvs" by the CVSNT server) so that the CVS_ROOT 
is :pserver:pollaehne@pollaehne.seeburger.de:/var/cvs
The JDK versions are 1.3.1_02 and 1.4.0 (both are tested as runtime for 
eclipse and behaviour is the same).
Eclipse build is the integration build as of 20020409.

I created a java project (kXML) and shared this project. It contains the 
folders bin, src and apidocs. Except the bin directory everything is committed 
to CVS.
After sharing the project I removed the project from my workspace and tried to 
checkout the project from the repository.
In the CVS perspective I called the context menu on the folder kXML in the 
HEAD stream and selected "checkout as project". As result the following was 
created:
directory kXML
directory kXML/CVS
file      kXML/.project       (newly created, not from the repository)
file      kXML/CVS/Repository (content: "kXML")
file      kXML/CVS/Root       
(content: ":pserver:pollaehne@pollaehne.seeburger.de:/var/cvs")
That was all.
After that I changed to the resource perspective and selected "Team-
>Synchronize with repository..." from the context menu of the kXML item in the 
Navigator view. After some work the result was an internal error with 
the .metadata/.log file containing the following:
=========snip=========

There is still no entries file in the CVS directory.

Sometimes it seems to be better to wait with a bug report. ;-)
I am not able to confirm the mentioned patch but before starting intensive 
search please have a look at <http://www.cvsnt.org/pipermail/cvsnt/2002-
April/004498.html>

If you use the full repository path (i.e C:\var\cvs) then Eclipse will detect 
that you are connecting to a CVSNT server (we look for the leading device X:) 
and do what is necessary to work with CVSNT 1.11.1.3 (If you are using build 
I20020409 or later). Although we do not officially support CVSNT, I have been 
doing some testing against 1.11.1.3 and haven't encountered any problems yet.

If I do apply the patch as described in 
<http://www.cvsnt.org/pipermail/cvsnt/2002-April/004498.html> the checkout 
from :pserver:pollaehne@pollaehne.seeburger.de:/var/cvs does work as expected 
therefor this is not a problem with eclipse and I do close the bug as invalid.
